abstract: Rajat K. Gupta, the retired head of the consulting firm McKinsey & Company and a former Goldman Sachs board member, is the most prominent executive convicted in the government’s sweeping investigation into insider trading on Wall Street.
snippet: Rajat K. Gupta, the retired head of the consulting firm McKinsey & Company and a former Goldman Sachs board member, is the most prominent executive convicted in the government’s sweeping investigation into insider trading on Wall Street.
lead_paragraph: Rajat K. Gupta, the retired head of the consulting firm McKinsey & Company and a former Goldman Sachs board member, was found guilty on Friday of conspiracy and securities fraud for leaking boardroom secrets to a billionaire hedge fund manager.

headline.main: Rajat Gupta Convicted of Insider Trading
headline.print_headline: Ex-Goldman Director Convicted Of Passing Secrets to Hedge Fund

byline.original: By Peter Lattman and Azam Ahmed
